preqs: A Distinction average in 24 points at level three in PHY, DEV, GEN, IMM or BCH units or an approved relevant discipline; or 18 points of PHY, DEV, GEN, IMM or BCH units and 6 points in an approved relevant discipline.
description: The Honours year aims to develop analytic abilities, research skills, and communication skills, as well as provide students with advanced knowledge in specific areas of: heart and muscle development and regeneration immunity and regeneration stem cells, cancer and regeneration neural regeneration.In this unit, training is in the context of a scientific project, with an aim to train students in cutting edge scientific techniques as well as developing broad generic skills. Students undertake a supervised research project of a publishable standard that forms the basis of a thesis due at the end of the year. Students will also present seminars on their research throughout the year.
